questions.text: Who plays rhythm guitar in Aerosmith?
questions.explanation:
Brad Whitford.

	Joe Perry plays lead.

questions.text: Which of these guitarists never played guitar in the Yardbirds?
questions.explanation: Jimi Hendrix.

questions.text: Can you name Eric Clapton's black Stratocaster?
questions.explanation:
Blackie.

	Eric has now 'retired' Blackie, due to the amount of abuse it has received from gigs over the years.

questions.text: Which famous guitarist wrote the soundtrack for Death Wish 2?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Page.

	One of Jimmy's rare projects away from Led Zeppelin

questions.text: Which company produced the first steel-strung guitar?
questions.explanation:
Martin.

	It was called a 'Dreadnought'

questions.text: Which guitarist first used a 100 watt amplifier?
questions.explanation:
Pete Townshend.

	Pete approached legendary amp-maker Marshall, and specifically requested an amp capable of producing 100 watts of sound. How long it lasted is another issue altogether, of course.

questions.text: Who was the first guitarist to intentionally use distortion on a recording?
questions.explanation:
Link Wray.

	He poked holes in the speaker of his amp with a pen, thus creating the ripped fuzzy effect we all know and love in 1958. Many people credit Ray Davies, but Link did it first.

questions.text: Which David Bowie track did the late Texas blues guitarist Stevie Ray Vaughan famously play on?
questions.explanation:
Let's Dance.

	Stevie also played on James Brown's 'Living In America'.

questions.text: What's the name given to the device clamped across the neck of a guitar to create an artificial nut?
questions.explanation:
Capo.

	It saves learning new chord shapes to play in different keys.

questions.text: When did Les Paul create 'The Log', the first solidbody electric guitar?
questions.explanation:
1939.

	Les Paul also pioneered delay and muti-track recording.

questions.text: In 1977, which company launched the first guitar synthesiser?
questions.explanation:
Roland.

	They are still very much at the forefront of guitar-synth technology today.

questions.text: Eddie Van Halen soloed on Michael Jackson's 'Beat It'. Who provided the riff?
questions.explanation:
Steve Lukather.

	Slash provided guitar on Michael's 'Black or White', and 'Give In To Me' from the 'Dangerous' album.

questions.text: What did BB King name his guitar?
questions.explanation:
Lucille.

	When BB flies, he buys a ticket for his guitar and keeps it in the seat next to him rather than put it in the luggage hold.

questions.text: What is the make and model of Queen guitarist Brian May's amp of choice?
questions.explanation:
Vox AC30.

	Brian will use up to a dozen amps on stage.

questions.text: Who founded the G3 tour?
questions.explanation:
Satriani.

	The G3 tour sells out almost every show.

questions.text: Who released an album called Passion and Warfare in 1990?
questions.explanation:
Steve Vai.

	For many rock guitarists, this is still the quintessential rock guitar instrumental album.

questions.text: What do you call the bell-like sounds created by resting left-hand fingers lightly over the fretwire at the 12th fret?
questions.explanation:
Harmonics.

	These are known as 'natural' harmonics. Other types include 'pinch' harmonics and 'harp' harmonics

questions.text: Who makes a guitar called a Fly?
questions.explanation:
Parker.

	The Parker Fly is noted for its radical appearance, and its extremely light weight.

questions.text: Who invented the humbucking pickup?
questions.explanation:
Seth E. Lover

	Seymour Duncan teamed up with Seth to create what Seymour called his 'Antiquity' range - classic vintage humbucking pickups.

questions.text: The non-music system of guitar notation is known as what?
questions.explanation:
Tablature & Tab.

	Tab is made up of 6 horizontal lines which represent the 6 strings of the guitar, and aremarked with number to indicate which fret of the should be struck, on which string.

questions.text: Where did Jimi Hendrix famously set fire to his guitar onstage?
questions.explanation:
Monterey.

	Apparently he did it so he wouldn't be upstaged by Pete Townsend's guitar-smashing antics when The Who played after Hendrix's set.

questions.text: This country guitarist played guitar for Elvis Presley?
questions.explanation: Chet Atkins.

questions.text: Which of these is the legendary Spinal Tap guitarist?
questions.explanation:
Nigel Tufnel.

	Nigel, played by actor Christopher Guest, holds the title of an English Lord, Lord Hayden-Guest, and may sit in The House of Lords in London for any meeting. He is also married to actress Jamie Lee Curtis.

questions.text: Which of these terms is a Spanish technique involving a strumming motion across the strings?
questions.explanation: Rasgueado.

questions.text: Can you name the first Fender guitar?
questions.explanation:
Esquire.

	Fender released their Esquire guitar in 1950, and followed it with the Broadcaster the next year. The Broadcaster was renamed the Telecaster in 1951. Broadcasters and Telecasters differ from the Esquire in that they have two pickups, while the Esquire only has one.
